info.title: Staffbase
info.description: This connector provides access to your Staffbase instance

get.summary: Channels: Get a list of news channels
get.description: Get a list of news channels

get.summary: Channels: Get a list of posts within the specified channel
get.description: Get a list of posts within the specified channel

parameters.name: channelID
parameters.description: Insert channel ID, e.g. retrieved by getChannels

post.summary: Channels: Send a post to specific channel
post.description: Send a post to specific news channel

parameters.name: channelID
parameters.description: Insert channel ID

externalID.description: Optional: Enter a external ID here
externalID.title: ExternalID

locale.description: Insert locale like, e.g. de_DE, en_US, etc.
locale.title: Locale

parameters.name: manage
parameters.description: When true and the token role allows manage comments - also not published comments will be shown in the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of items that should be returned (default and maximum 100)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Define an offset for getting the items starting at this number.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter in SCIM2 format with partial support. For now only flat structure (no nested clauses) and comparison clauses like eq = "equals", gt = "greater than", ge = "greater than or equals", lt = "less than", le = "less than or equals" are supported.  For comments supported filter fields are: created and updated. The value for these fields can be provided in UTC DateTime string representatiion or long number of milliseconds of Unix epoch.  Example 1: filter=updated ge "2020-11-26T10:14:48.947Z" and updated le "2020-11-26T10:14:48.947Z". In this example the DateTime range filter is applied to updated field with ge and le comparison clauses and and boolean clause.  Example 2: filter=created gt "2020-11-26T10:14:48.947Z". Get all comments, created after pointed date.

get.description: Get metadata of all media that are accessible for the API token

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit number of items

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for query

get.description: Get metadata for single media by its ID

parameters.name: mediumID
parameters.description: Requests information on a specific medium.

delete.description: Deletes the specified media in the current context

parameters.name: mediumID
parameters.description: Deletes the medium by its ID. While this will immediately remove the resource from our servers, the CDN may still deliver the content via the URL stated in resourceInfo.url until CDN invalidation.

locale.description: Insert locale like, e.g. de_DE, en_US, etc.
locale.title: Locale

get.summary: Posts: Get a list of posts
get.description: Get a list of posts that are accessible for the API token

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A string that is used for searching in any profile field available for users, such as firstname, lastname, or location.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of items that should be returned (default and maximum 100)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Define an offset for getting the items starting at this number.

get.summary: Posts: Get a post by ID
get.description: Requests the specified posts including a set of comments

parameters.name: pageID
parameters.description: The Staffbase Page ID

parameters.name: pageID
parameters.description: This could be either the post’s ID defined by the API or if set the post’s externalID.

delete.description: Removes a post from the system

put.description: Updates a post, only changed field (incremental)

parameters.name: pageID
parameters.description: This could be either the post’s ID defined by the API or if set the post’s externalID.

parameters.description: The ID can be based on either the UserID automatically generated by the Staffbase platform or the externalID, if it is added for the user.
